member.summary: Execute the logic for the activity

members.member: Specifies the name of a WMI class. When this parameter is used, the cmdlet retrieves instances of the WMI class. summary>

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerShell.Activities.GetWmiObject.Property
member.summary: Specifies the WMI class property or set of properties to retrieve.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerShell.Activities.GetWmiObject.Filter
member.summary: Specifies a Where clause to use as a filter. Uses the syntax of the WMI Query Language (WQL).

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerShell.Activities.GetWmiObject.Query
member.summary: Specifies a WMI Query Language (WQL) statement to run. Event queries are not supported by this parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerShell.Activities.GetWmiObject.Amended
member.summary: Indicates whether the objects that are returned from WMI should contain amended information. Typically, amended information is localizable information, such as object and property descriptions, that is attached to the WMI object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerShell.Activities.GetWmiObject.DirectRead
member.summary: Specifies whether direct access to the WMI provider is requested for the specified class without any regard to its base class or to its derived classes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.PowerShell.Workflow.StorageVariable.IsAggregatingVariable
member.summary: This indicates if the variable is one that will aggregate results from a parallel/sequence/foreach block. For example: workflow bar { $a = parallel { Get-Process -Name powershell; Get-Service -Name Dhcp } } $a here will contain all results generated from the parallel block, including a process object "powershell" and a service object "Dhcp". We call $a an aggregating variable.
